intro: Ricinocarpos tuberculatus, commonly known as the rough-horned violets, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Ricinocarpos tuberculatus is native to regions of North America and is often found in the eastern United States.
